title: Special-Rcology
text:
üõ†Ô∏è This is a Quarto website still in development. üèóÔ∏è

Setup
You can easily contribute via github by following these steps:

‚ÄúLow key contribution‚Äù: Just leave a comment on the article you want to enhance. This is especially wanted for general feedback (structure, content etc.)!
‚ÄúI want to add notes myself!‚Äù

No problem! It‚Äôs very easy, really. To get started, watch this video for 2 minutes and you‚Äôre good to go!
Here‚Äôs a transcript of what to do:






Important




Create a github account here!
Install git on your machine.
Go to the project‚Äôs website repository.
Fork it by clicking the button on the top right!
After linking the forked repo to your account, clone/download the files at your desired destination using:

git clone https://github.com/soekni/Special-Rcology.git
in your terminal/console.  Make sure to open the terminal at your desired location or change the directory using the ‚Äúcd locationToYourPath‚Äù.


Now you‚Äôre good to go! Change/Add files/notes using Quarto. Check out this article for learning the basics of markdown to just get started!  If you want to learn more about authoring content/styling, visit the respective site in the navigation bar on the left.


Further reading
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.


Troubleshooting
You can leave a comment or contact me directly when you‚Äôre having issues following the setup. Ideally, this should be a ‚Äúmany hands make light work‚Äù - kind of thing.

title: Roadmap
text:
I‚Äôll just put my initial ideas for further Rticles üòè here:

Advanced Basics of \(R\) (Loops, Functions, Examples)
Basic Statistics in \(R\) with examples (t-tests, linear models, examples)
Further statistics (GLM, GAM, NLS and when to use them)
Statistical theory (MLE, sum of least squares, normal distribution, equations)
Baysian Statistics in \(R\)
Literature recommendations/Further readings for each Rticle

You can add your ideas down below by commenting.

title: The Idea
text:
The aim of this site is simple:
Gather up useful information on R, Ecology and Statistics here.
Use it as a ‚Äúcheat sheet‚Äù or digital garden for basic knowledge.
You can help by participating or pointing out mistakes by commenting.

title: Rste Schritte
text: When first using \(R\), try this website (in german) or this resource in english.

title: Authoring Content
text:
Important



TLDR;
Create a new Quarto file (.qmd-file) in RStudio and save it within the main directory (where the .Rproj-file is). Then just add the name of the .qmd-file to the _quarto.yml file (also open it within RStudio). Like this:

website:
  title: "Special-Rcology"
  navbar:
    left:
      - href: about.qmd
        text: The Idea
      - href: authoring.qmd
        text: Authoring
      - href: *YOUR CONTENT.qmd*
        text: *YOUR NAME FOR CONTENT*
        




A markup/markdown file is a text file with embedded commands.
These commands can be simple text formatting characters or complete R scripts. A rmd-file (‚ÄúR-Markdown‚Äù) is a mixture of R commands, normal text and formatting code.



For a cheat sheet on markdown/quarto basics, visit this site or have a look on the basic syntax for additional information. Markdown commands for special formatting such as adding colors, embedding comments, videos or table of contents, can be found here. For an interactive beginners markdown tutorial, click here. The latter one is especially recommended. ü´∂üèªü•π‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
An impressive resource for teaching markdown to instructors can be addressed on this site! Quarto emojis can be copied from this glossar. Everyone likes emojis, right? (À∂ÀÉ ·µï ÀÇÀ∂)
Useful Quarto Extensions (for Blogging/HTML):








Name
Purpose
Link




WebR
Run any R-Code on HTML file in an interactive console
https://yt.artemislena.eu/watch?v=DoRR2S5lLvk






When you‚Äôre really in the mood of doing a deep dive into Quarto‚Äôs possibilities: Here‚Äôs a list of extensions for everything! üèÜ



Please leave a comment when you still need help after looking for the right commands etc.
